title: Ahazu
data:
**Ahazu, the Seizer** is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Ritual, seal and taboo](#Ritual.2C_seal_and_taboo)

- [2 Mark](#Mark)

- [3 Benefits](#Benefits)

- [4 As a monster](#As_a_monster)

  - [4.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [4.2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Ritual, seal and taboo

Ahazu's seal must be drawn in a square containing a [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit"). An [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder") begins the game with knowledge of Ahazu's seal.

To remain bound to Ahazu, you must not become [weak](/wiki/Weak "Weak") from hunger.

## Mark

A character that has Ahazu bound will have a starry void in the back of their throat. This mark can only be seen up close, and can be hidden by wearing a mask or R'lyehian faceplate.

## Benefits

While bound, Ahazu confers immunity to [engulfing](/wiki/Engulfing "Engulfing") attacks of any kind, and grants skill in [flails](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), including [heavy iron balls](/wiki/Heavy_iron_ball "Heavy iron ball") as with [Convicts](/wiki/Convict "Convict").

Ahazu's active powers are as follows:

- **Abduction**: This targets a single adjacent monster that you have injured with a melee attack, or a thrown or fired projectile, and removes it from the game along with its inventory - the only exceptions to this are [unique items](/wiki/Unique_item "Unique item") and indestructible [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") (i.e. the [alignment keys](/wiki/Alignment_key_\(dNethack\) "Alignment key (dNethack)"), [The Annulus](/wiki/The_Annulus "The Annulus"), [The Silver Key](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Silver_Key "DNetHack artifacts"), and [The Pen of the Void](/wiki/The_Pen_of_the_Void "The Pen of the Void")).

  - This does not kill the monster: you do not receive any experience, it is not counted as killed for the purposes of quests or other objects (including the Temple of Chaos artifacts), and there is no way to bring it back.
  - [Prayer timeout](/wiki/Prayer_timeout "Prayer timeout") is decreased as though you had [sacrificed](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") the victim; if your god is [angry](/wiki/Angry "Angry"), their anger is instead reduced by the value of the "sacrifice". You also gain any beneficial effects as though you ate that monster's [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"): this avoids harmful effects, but does not confer any [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition").

Ahazu's passive powers are as follows:

- **Engulf**: Monsters you attack in melee that are at 1⁄10 HP or less are automatically abducted as above. This is meant to be as much a hindrance as a help.
- **Shadow Well**: Monsters you attack in melee have a 1⁄5 chance of losing their next move.
- **Swallow**: You can eat any meal in 1 turn, with the effects that meal would cause occurring as normal - the duration of any [temporary intrinsic](/wiki/Temporary_intrinsic "Temporary intrinsic") you would receive is reduced by 1⁄10.
- **Hunger**: You lose nutrition at a rate of 1 extra point per 10 turns.

In notdNetHack, **Ahazu**, &, also appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is a [medium](/wiki/Medium "Medium")-sized [major demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") that is [amorphous](/wiki/Amorphous "Amorphous"), [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious"), [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), and [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") - he can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), will pick up and collect items, and [follows](/wiki/Follow "Follow") a player character to other levels if he is adjacent.

Ahazu has a hunger-inducing touch similar to that of [Famine](/wiki/Famine "Famine") and a [digestion](/wiki/Digestion "Digestion") attack, and possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and [death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance"). Like most summoned spirits, he cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame") and will turn [traitor](/wiki/Traitor "Traitor") if somehow made tame.

Ahazu is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to consume, which primarily comes up if he is [digested](/wiki/Digest "Digest") by another monster.

### Generation

Ahazu is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Ahazu is [always generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") 4 or 5 [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration").

Ahazu [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

Ahazu, the Seizer is a spirit that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack.

Ritual, seal and taboo

Ahazu's seal must be drawn in a square containing a pit. An Illithanachronounbinder begins the game with knowledge of Ahazu's seal.

To remain bound to Ahazu, you must not become weak from hunger.

Mark

A character that has Ahazu bound will have a starry void in the back of their throat. This mark can only be seen up close, and can be hidden by wearing a mask or R'lyehian faceplate.

Benefits

While bound, Ahazu confers immunity to engulfing attacks of any kind, and grants skill in flails, including heavy iron balls as with Convicts.

Ahazu's active powers are as follows:

  • Abduction: This targets a single adjacent monster that you have injured with a melee attack, or a thrown or fired projectile, and removes it from the game along with its inventory - the only exceptions to this are unique items and indestructible artifacts (i.e. the alignment keys, The Annulus, The Silver Key, and The Pen of the Void).
    • This does not kill the monster: you do not receive any experience, it is not counted as killed for the purposes of quests or other objects (including the Temple of Chaos artifacts), and there is no way to bring it back.
    • Prayer timeout is decreased as though you had sacrificed the victim; if your god is angry, their anger is instead reduced by the value of the "sacrifice". You also gain any beneficial effects as though you ate that monster's corpse: this avoids harmful effects, but does not confer any nutrition.

Ahazu's passive powers are as follows:

  • Engulf: Monsters you attack in melee that are at 1⁄10 HP or less are automatically abducted as above. This is meant to be as much a hindrance as a help.
  • Shadow Well: Monsters you attack in melee have a 1⁄5 chance of losing their next move.
  • Swallow: You can eat any meal in 1 turn, with the effects that meal would cause occurring as normal - the duration of any temporary intrinsic you would receive is reduced by 1⁄10.
  • Hunger: You lose nutrition at a rate of 1 extra point per 10 turns.

In notdNetHack, Ahazu, &, also appears as a monster that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is a medium-sized major demon that is amorphous, amphibious, strong, and unbreathing - he can be seen via infravision, will pick up and collect items, and follows a player character to other levels if he is adjacent.

Ahazu has a hunger-inducing touch similar to that of Famine and a digestion attack, and possesses fire resistance, poison resistance and death resistance. Like most summoned spirits, he cannot be tamed and will turn traitor if somehow made tame.

Ahazu is poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if he is digested by another monster.

Generation

Ahazu is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Ahazu is always generated with 4 or 5 food rations.

Ahazu does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role. They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

Ahazu's hunger touch attack is very dangerous to an early Illithanachronounbinder during the first encounter, though his engulfing attack is negated by having him bound. Ranged attacks are the best option against him.

Ahazu can be encountered again in the Void, which is accessed by opening the high altar of Ilsensine the Fallen as an Illithanachronounbinder using the invoke effect of The Elder Cerebral Fluid. Ahazu is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him nonliving.
